seprhou.logic

Class Airspace

  • java.lang.Object
    • seprhou.logic.Airspace

  • public class Airspace
extends Object
    Controls an entire air space and all the aircraft in it

    The game logic is designed to be polled each frame for events rather than call callback methods. Each frame, you should call the refresh(float) method, and then use the other methods to observe the new state of the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Airspace

        public Airspace(Rectangle dimensions,
        AirspaceObjectFactory factory)
        Creates a new airspace

        null is a valid value for the object factory but if specified, no aircraft will be generated automatically and all takeoffs will fail.

        Parameters:
        dimensions - dimensions of the airspace
        factory - object factor used to generate aircraft

    • Method Detail

        public AirspaceObjectFactory getObjectFactory()
        Returns the factory responsible for constructing airspace objects

        Returns the dimensions of the airspace

        public void setFlightPlanGenerator(FlightPlanGenerator flightPlanGenerator)
        Sets a new flight path generator
        Parameters:
        flightPlanGenerator - new flight path generator

      • getLateralSeparation

        public float getLateralSeparation()
        Returns the lateral separation distance to generate warnings at

        This only affects the collision warnings. Actual crashes are determined from the aircraft sizes

        See Also:
        AirspaceObject.getSize()

      • setLateralSeparation

        public void setLateralSeparation(float separation)
        Sets the new lateral separation distance
        Parameters:
        separation - lateral separation distance to generate warnings at
        See Also:
        getLateralSeparation()

      • getVerticalSeparation

        public float getVerticalSeparation()
        Returns the vertical separation distance to generate warnings at

        This only affects the collision warnings. Actual crashes are determined from the aircraft sizes

        See Also:
        AirspaceObject.getSize()

      • setVerticalSeparation

        public void setVerticalSeparation(float separation)
        Sets the new vertical separation distance
        Parameters:
        separation - vertical separation distance to generate warnings at
        See Also:
        getVerticalSeparation()

      • getCulledObjects

        public Collection<AirspaceObject> getCulledObjects()
        Returns the aircraft which were culled during the last refresh

        This is the list of aircraft which flew off the screen and were therefore culled / destroyed.

        The returned list is reused each refresh (so you must copy it if you want to keep it between refreshes)

      • getLandedObjects

        public int getLandedObjects()
        Returns the number of landed objects

      • setLandedObjects

        public void setLandedObjects(int landed)
        Forces the number of landed objects
        Parameters:
        landed - number of landed objects

      • getActiveObjects

        public Collection<AirspaceObject> getActiveObjects()
        Returns the list of active aircraft

        These objects are sorted by altitude (small altitudes first)

      • getCollisionWarnings

        public Collection<CollisionWarning> getCollisionWarnings()
        Returns the list of collision warnings generated during the last refresh

        The returned list is unmodifiable and is reused each refresh (so you must copy it if you want to keep it between refreshes)

      • findAircraft

        public AirspaceObject findAircraft(Vector2D centre)
        Finds the aircraft which is occupying the given point

        This method takes into account the size of aircraft to determine where they are. If multiple aircraft occupy a point, the one with the HIGHEST altitude will be chosen

        Parameters:
        centre - point to start search at
        Returns:
        the aircraft found occupying the given point

      • cycleAircraft

        public AirspaceObject cycleAircraft()

      • findAircraft

        public List<AirspaceObject> findAircraft(Vector2D centre,
                                float radius)
        Finds the aircraft who's centres are within the given circle

        Objects are ordered with highest altitude first

        Parameters:
        centre - the centre of the circle to search
        radius - the radius of the circle to search
        Returns:
        the list of aircraft found - may be empty of no aircraft were found

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over

      • setGameOver

        public void setGameOver(boolean value)
        Force the game over flag

      • takeOff

        public boolean takeOff()
        Requests that a plane takes off

        This method can fail if there are no landed planes or if the AirspaceObjectFactory implementation returned null.

        Returns:
        true if a plane actually took off

      • refresh

        public void refresh(float delta)
        Called every so often to refresh the game state

        Normally this is called every frame before the game is drawn to the screen.

        The delta parameter allows the game to be frame-rate independent. This means the game should appear to run at the same speed regardless of the frame-rate. If you do not want this, you can use the value 1 / fps as the value for delta

        Parameters:
        delta - the time (in seconds) since the last refresh

      • draw

        public void draw(Object state)
        Draws all objects in the airspace

        This effectively calls AirspaceObject.draw(Object) on all objects.

        Parameters:
        state - any state information to be passed to the drawer

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the current Score

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int score)
        Sets the Score to an integer provided

      • getLandingPlanes

        public int getLandingPlanes()
        Returns the list of all Planes landed in the Airspace

      • setLandingPlanes

        public void setLandingPlanes(int landingPlanes)
        Sets the List of all Planes that have landed in the Airspace
